Description: Egyptian terracotta female figure, naked, covering breast with left hand, which was also holding something (now lost). Left side of torso only. White coating traces, or plaster. Mould-made and hollow with crude back. Dark brown Nile silt fabric with black core. Abundant fine gold mica, quartz, organics and white inclusions.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Classical Archaeology, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Possibly made at Naukratis of Nile silt fabric. Probably from a Ptolemaic period Isis figure. Two lines 'l\' written on back in pencil. Possibly '13'?
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (DD.161) (Phase 1)
